item.title: [DISTRELEC-4340] Checkout tracking in FF not correct
item.description: In my current search report (7.5. - 6.6. CH-DE) I have items with a very high Checkout Value, which is simply unrealistic. Could you please check if there is a mistake in the tracking? Or where these figures come from? Especially the * searches generate high figures in every report.
item.summary: Checkout tracking in FF not correct

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Added frontend stuff, but when I do an add to cart with the new parameter, I currently get a nullpointer exception..back to you Raphi.
Please test.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5674] SEO - Migration issue - ;jsession id to redirect to their origin url
item.description:
Observations :

  • 52% of Google crawl on distrelec.de is done on duplicated url containing jsessionid parameter.
  • With the migration, this url pattern land on a 404.

Impacts :

  • Half of google crawl is wasted on duplicated url.
  • Those 404 are highly negative for the migration of the new website.

Demands :

To fix this issue, we need to implement one redirection rules :

  • Redirect in 301 every url that contain ;jsessionid=* to their original path.
    Exemple :
    distrelec.de/crimp-housing-1x3p/molex/70066-0177-5057-9403/118291/en;jsessionid=23975004D505C3033DCA75EA66769B04.daechj012u
    =301>
    distrelec.de/crimp-housing-1x3p/molex/70066-0177-5057-9403/118291/en

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Migration issue - ;jsession id to redirect to their origin url

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Pierre,
this rule has been implemented:

RewriteRule ^/(.*)(?:jsessionid=.*(?:daechj010u|daechj011u|daechj012u|daechj013u))(.*$)  http://%{SERVER_NAME}/$1$2? [R=301,L]

At the moment this configuration will be available only on quality system with next deploy.
As soon as this change is available on Q please let me know if it works, then i'll move to production.

Great news !

The rule fit exactly what we need !
We can optimise it with a less restrictive regex :

access logs analysis

$ cat * | fgrep "distrelec.de" | fgrep "ooglebot" | cut -d" " -f8 | fgrep ";jsessionid=" | grep -v "daechj010u|daechj011u|daechj012u|daechj013u" | cut -d"." -f2 | cut -d"?" -f1 | sort | uniq -c | sort -r

access logs results

26724 daechj010u
26376 daechj012u
25630 daechj013u
25598 daechj011u
71 chdist142
64 chdist140
46 chdist143
39 chdist144
33 chdist141

ht access jsessionid rule v2 proposition
RewriteRule ^/(.*)(?:jsessionid=.*(?:daechj010u|daechj011u|daechj012u|daechj013u|chdist140|chdist141|chdist142|chdist143|chdist144))(.*$)  http://%{SERVER_NAME}/$1$2? [R=301,L]

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5661] DE - Display warning in case of login failure
item.description:
Requirement
In case of a failed login-attempt, the following message should be shown in germany:

  • DE: "Falls Ihr bisheriges Login nicht mehr funktioniert, können Sie sich über "Registrierung mit Kundennummer" erneut mit Ihrem bestehenden Account verbinden."
  • EN: "If your login is not working anymore you can use the "registration with customer number" functionality in order to connect again with your active account."
item.summary: DE - Display warning in case of login failure

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please test after the next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5658] Wrong labels used in channel selector
item.description:
Hi Jan

Here is the ticket we discussed today. There is a bug in the lightbox-shopsettings.js. The labels used to display the channel (Geschäftskunde / Privatkunde) are coming from the last entry in the matchingTable instead of the one regarding the chosen country.
The best way to test it locally is defining some own names for e.g. the Swiss channels.

Cheers,
Adi

PS: What do you think about the idea to load the matchingTable asynchronously? This list is 16kB in size and transferred in the base page every time (but used very seldom).
If not possible, we should at least reduce the number of tabs/spaces in the JSP.
item.summary: Wrong labels used in channel selector

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I created a CR for the performance improvement idea (DISTRELEC-5687).
Can be tested after next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5628] Display of Advisor campaigns without images not as defined, anymore
item.description:
Advisor campaigns without images are displayed with quite some space and the missing little arrow to indicate the link.

Should be the old layout again.
item.summary: Display of Advisor campaigns without images not as defined, anymore

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: waiting for some clarification from RH und DT

@Daniela: As discussed the format that you can use are the following:

  • Just text: Just place the text that you want to display (not attributes needed)
  • Just image: image=http://path_to_the_image
  • Text and image: text=This is the text image=http://path_to_the_image

For text and image it does not matter if you put in first the text or the image attribute, just between the end of the text and the image attribute or vise-versa you need to put a space.
For an example you can have a look into the test system, channel distrelec_Q_7310_ch_de for the advisor campaign called "Kamera Bild-TEST"

If you have any questions or something should not work as expected, just contact me!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4939] Orderhistory - B2B: Company1&2 instead of Company3
item.description:
Issue
Applies to Germany & Lithuania:

  • In checkout step 3 billing and shipping address is displayed but in the shipping-address there's first-&lastname missing.
  • In the order-history-details it takes company1&2 instead of company3.

Note
In LT there's never a separate shipping address. Billing- and shipping address are always the same. I think because of this change, it tries to take the values from the wrong place.

Actions
Please fix these two issues in order to have the correct first-&lastname(from Company3 field at registration) shown in order-history-details and checkout step 3.
item.summary: Orderhistory - B2B: Company1&2 instead of Company3

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate & assign back.
This is a FE task.
Description adjusted. Still frontend task?
Yes it is a pure FE task
Please estimate, thanks

Hi Rafael,
FE estimation: 8h
Thanks

Hi Rafael,

I think is a BackEnd issue. In the FrontEnd we have this line in the file "address-shipping-b2b.jsp" (line 37):

<c:out value="$

{address.firstName}

" /> <c:out value="$

{address.lastName}

" />

So, for some reason, the values of firstName and lastName are incorrect.
In the checkout, is exactly the same FE code, and the values are correct.

Nabil, could you have a look please?
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5479] CH-OCI // Givaudan - Problem mit checkout OCI Schnittstelle
item.description:
Hallo Herr Sautter

Können Sie bitte noch den letzten Knopf welchen man drücken kann bevor der Artikel übergeben wird entfernen? Wenn man ihn nicht drückt wird der Artikel automatisch übergeben und wenn ihn drückt bekommen wie den Artikel doppelt in unseren Warenkorb.

Mit freundlichem Gruss
Stefan Himmler
item.summary: CH-OCI // Givaudan - Problem mit checkout OCI Schnittstelle

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: https://www.distrelec.ch/ociEntry?username=givaudan-ch-ger@oci.distrelec&password=jekslky3772&oci_version=4.0&hook_url=http://q08.elfa.se:50000/elfa3/catalogdb/DisplayParametersServlet&oci_version=4.0

Hi Oliver,
Ist das der einzige Kunde, der diese Erfahrung gemacht hat oder gibt es noch weitere?
Könntest Du mal nachfragen falls Du keine Antwort hast?
Das ist bisher der einzige Kunde

Hallo René
Könntest Du bitte schauen, dass der Button nicht mehr angezeigt wird?
Gemäss Tel mit Florian: Eine Processing Animated-Gif anzeigen.

Jan Widmer

Kannst du das machen?

  • Button ausblenden wenn nicht "dev"
  • Progress Bild anzeigen
    • hybris/bin/custom/distrelecB2Bstorefront/web/webroot/_ui/all/dibs-payment/elfatest/images/throbber_small_grey_white_matte.gif

Hallo Rene,

Die Generierung des Markups erfolgt im Java (Siehe Printscreen Page File). Es sollte deshalb durch einen BE erledigt werden.

Gruss Jan

Hallo Jan

Ja das stimmt, aber das ist Hybris Standard Code und
ich kann somit den Button im BE nicht so einfach deaktivieren.

Kannst du den im FE einfach ausblenden?
Ich hab den Button ausgeblendet, kann es aber lokal nicht testen, da ich nicht in den OCI Mode komme. Kann ab dem nächsten deployment getestet werden.
